definition: to recognize/to remember sth (or sb) on seeing it/to know
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: About a month after her arrival, she taught me the word "water".
sentences.chinese: 她来后约莫一个月，就教我认得了“水”这个词。

sentences.english: After two classes, I started to recognize several of the faces in each class.
sentences.chinese: 两节课下来，每个班上我都已经认得好几张面孔了。

sentences.english: He got one apostle to say he did not even know Christ.
sentences.chinese: 他曾抓住一个使徒，叫他说他不认得主。

sentences.english: They look exactly the same. How can you tell which is which?
sentences.chinese: 他们看起来完全一样，你怎么认得出谁是谁啊？

sentences.english: She couldn't recognize her face. Then she would start crying at times and laughing at times," Pillai says.
sentences.chinese: 她不认得自己的脸，还时而哭时而笑，”皮拉伊说。

sentences.english: Can you recognize the car thief?
I boasted among men that I had known you.
sentences.chinese: 我在人前夸说我认得你。

sentences.english: Monsieur Defarge alighted; knowing one or two of the soldiery there, and one of the police.
sentences.chinese: 德伐日认得那儿的两个士兵和一个警察。

sentences.english: They also knew his cowboy hat, which he wore every day.
sentences.chinese: 马也认得他的每天戴着的牛仔帽。

sentences.english: The teacher flashed up each word to see if the children would recognize it.
sentences.chinese: 老师把每一个单词举起晃了一晃，看孩子们是否认得。

sentences.english: 'You recognize me?I have changed a lot, 'she answered.
sentences.chinese: “你认得出我？我变了许多，”她回答。

sentences.english: Many of those who joined in it, uninvited, we did not even know.
sentences.chinese: 许多不请自来的参加者，我们连认都不认得。

sentences.english: Lest I should know you too easily, you play with me.
sentences.chinese: 只恐我太轻易地认得你，你对我耍花招。

sentences.english: I may not evermore acknowledge thee.
Recognize this transparent body, the wisdom of the leaves fall in the world?
sentences.chinese: 认得这透明体，智慧的叶子掉在人间？

definition: to be well acquainted with/to know well
to look at/to see/to see (a doctor)/to visit
to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)
to be called/to be known as
